items.title: Guide: Getting the Most Out of Events in Holoearth!
items.author: HoloearthWebsiteAdmin
items.content:
Hi there! This is Anna Rocca from the Holoearth Tourism Agency.

For today’s guide, I will introduce ways to better utilize Holoearth to improve your experience for NePoLaBo Live—enjoy using event items and gestures with everyone to really liven up the show!

Please continue reading to be fully prepared for the day of the event!

I will cover the following four categories this time:

1. Interacting with other users with gestures.2. Using penlights with gestures.3. Adjusting options settings for a better experience.4. Using Photo Mode and participating in the photo contest.5. Adjusting “Visuals” for a better experience.

One way to communicate with other users in Holoearth is with gestures. Press and hold the B key to open the gesture setup screen.

Click “Edit gestures” to display a list of gestures you have purchased, then drag and move the ones you want to set.

You can set up a total of 9 sets of gestures, each using the F1-F8 keys, so try switching between them depending on the situation.

You can wave penlights by combining them with gestures. You can set penlight items you have purchased in the hotbar at the bottom of the screen to make them faster to use.

After doing this, click the shortcut button or press the corresponding keyboard number to use it.

By combining it with gestures such as those in the “Hype Up” series, you will be able to wave the penlights.

Adjusting audio settings is also useful for making the most out of a concert experience. Press the Esc key to open the global options menu, then check the Sound section.

By adjusting the Media volume, you can change the volume of the performance. Set it to a level that feels comfortable for you and enjoy the show!

For NePoLaBo Live, photography is allowed. You will want to capture a special memory of your own, right?

Press P to switch to Photo Mode. Since you can shoot from many different angles, it offers more flexibility than a standard screenshot.

Also, a photo contest is planned for the NePoLaBo Live! Try posting your best shots on X with the hashtag #NePoLaBoHoloearthLive.

Your photo might be featured on the official website, or you could even receive a special gift…

For more details, check the URL below!

Here, you can toggle features like “NaviRobo Display,” “Other Users’ Actions” (such as poppers or fireworks), and adjust the number of player models rendered in the area. Enjoy the performance in a way suited just for you!

items.title: Holoearth First-Timers & How to Participate in NePoLaBo Live
items.author: HoloearthWebsiteAdmin
items.content:
Hi there! This is Anna Rocca from the Holoearth Tourism Agency.

With the upcoming virtual concert “NePoLaBo Live re:VISION Holoearth Live” on Sunday, December 21, 2025, I put together a brief guide for those who are new to Holoearth or who may be unfamiliar with how to use the service.

Please continue reading to be fully prepared for the day of the event!

To participate in the NePoLaBo Live concert in Holoearth, there are four things you will need to do, as listed below!

1. Download for PC (Windows). 2. Register an account with Google or Apple ID.

3. Purchase the “NePoLaBo Live re:VISION ID Holder” item in the shop in Holoearth.

4. Enter the “NePoLaBo re:VISION Holoearth Live” area in Holoearth after 18:00 (JST) on Dec 21 (Sun).

All that is needed to use Holoearth is a PC (Windows). No VR equipment is required. See the download page for PC spec requirements.

Holoearth is only available for Windows.

Feel free to use the following as a detailed reference guide for how to use Holoearth and participate!

1: Installing Holoearth & Account Creation

The Holoearth application must first be downloaded and installed before using the service.

Download the Holoearth launcher from the download page

Download the Holoearth Launcher from the download page and install it.

After installing the launcher, launch it via the “Holoearth Launcher” icon that was created.

Click “Install” to begin the installation of the main Holoearth application. After installation, this button will become the “Start” button.

When an update is available, the same button will change to “Update.”

Launcher Installation Troubleshooting

Click the gear icon in the upper right to open the launcher options menu, then choose “Support” from the menu and then “Open Log Folder” for the relevant error code that can be used when submitting a help inquiry.

Account Creation & Logging In

Once installed, the launcher will display a “Start” button, which will open your web browser.

If you do not yet have a Holoearth account, you will be prompted to create one, using either a Google account or Apple ID.

Then, agree to the Terms of Service and Privacy Policy and click Register to finish and log in.

Afterward, when Holoearth is installed and launched correctly the title menu will show the animated PV, “Now, discover your other world,” and prompt you to “CLICK TO START.”

On starting Holoearth for the first time, you will be asked to create your own avatar. Choose from a range of eyes, hairstyles, build options, skin tones, and more to create an avatar to your liking.

You can change your avatar freely in Holoearth later, so feel free to think more about it later!

After creating an avatar and entering Holoearth, you can control your avatar using a mouse and keyboard.

The above controls can also be confirmed in-app via the HoloPhone menu (H key) by selecting “Help.”

■ Character movement Move your avatar with WASD.

Change camera angle with the mouse.

■ Camera manipulation Zoom with the mouse wheel.

Right click & drag to rotate your avatar.

■ Opening menus Esc brings up the global settings menu.

H opens the HoloPhone menu.

Tab opens inventory.

4: Purchase the ID Holder Item

It is necessary to purchase the in-app “NePoLaBo Live re:VISION ID Holder” in order to participate in NePoLaBo Live.

1. Choose Shop from the HoloPhone menu.

2. Purchase the event ID Holoder item.

Note: This item is also included in the NePoLaBo Cheer Set bundles.

After purchasing, you will be able to enter the concert venue in Holoearth. Note:

5: How to Move to the Live Venue on Dec 21

1. Press H to bring up the HoloPhone menu and select “Change Area.”

2. From the Area List, select the “Holoearth Live” area and click “Go.”

Those who purchased the ID Holder will be able to also participate in the 3D archive after the first showing.

Explore the event from different angles, take photos, and relive your favorite scenes. The 3D archive is shown at certain times of day during the archive viewing period according to the following daily schedule:

Daily showtimes (JST) between Dec 21, 21:00 (JST) – Jan 4, 23:59 (JST) (1) 08:00~ (2) 12:00~ (3) 19:00~ (4) 21:00~ (5) 23:00~

Note: The 3D archive may be played via the event venue screens for activities such as talent watch parties.

6: More Tips for a Better Experience

By hitting the minus (“-“) key, you can hide the entire UI hud display to get an unobstructed view of the concert!

And that wraps it up for getting started with Holoearth and participating in NePoLaBo Live. Next time, I will share tips on how to get the most out of the Holoearth concert experience, so please look forward to it!

Greetings from the Holoearth Management Team!

For the “NePoLaBo Live re:VISION Holoearth Live” virtual concert on December 21, 2025, we will hold a photo contest.

We invite all to take in-app photos of hololive 5th Generation “NePoLaBo” (Momosuzu Nene / Omaru Polka / Yukihana Lamy / Shishiro Botan) from various angles, and be sure to share your very best shots!

NePoLaBo Live Support Campaign: Photo Contest!

For “NePoLaBo Live re:VISION Holoearth Live,” screenshots & social media posts are fully welcome. Share your perfect captures with us!

Top entries will be featured on the official website and receive NePoLaBo Live commemorative merch. Selected posts will also be showcased on the official X account during the contest.

1. Hide “NaviRobo” and “Usernames” in the Options menu.

2. Capture in 1920×1080 (Full HD) or higher.

3. Post your screenshots on X with the hashtags (no entry limit!):

English: #NePoLaBoHoloearthLive

Japanese: #ねぽらぼホロアースライブ

Take as many as you like! Replay the concert anytime in the 3D archive (requires purchase of the ID Holder).

Note: ・Turn “Motion Blur” off in Options (Esc key) to prevent photos from showing blur.

・In the concert venue you can use the O key shortcut to adjust the number of character models rendered and toggle other users’ effects (such as fireworks and poppers) ON/OFF. This helps reduce system load and offers more flexibility when taking photos.

Due to the nature of this content, which allows users to freely control the camera, it is produced in accordance with international safety standards and guidelines regarding visual display (such as flicker frequency and changes in brightness levels).

However, certain user actions may still produce unexpectedly strong visual stimuli. In particular, individuals with a history of photosensitivity (such as photosensitive epilepsy or light-induced sensitivity), those who are sleep-deprived or unwell, and minors should avoid the actions listed below and exercise caution when viewing this content.

Rapid and intense camera movements—such as panning quickly from side to side, tilting up and down, or repeatedly zooming in and out—may cause fast motion across the screen and strong flickering.

Sudden Approaches to Light Sources Suddenly moving the camera close to bright lights used in the live performance (such as stage lighting, lasers, fireworks, or effects), or filling the screen with a bright light source, may cause abrupt changes in brightness.

If you experience strong visual stimulation, dizziness, nausea, convulsions, or any vision abnormalities while viewing this content, stop immediately, look away from the screen, and take a break. If symptoms do not improve, promptly seek medical attention.

Please view this content at your own risk with thorough understanding of the above potential hazards. We kindly ask for your understanding and cooperation to ensure safe usage.

This is the Holoearth Management Team.

Holoearth was updated on November 19th, 2025.

■ Voice chat mirroring test release During events, users will be able hear the voice chat of hololive production talents even if they are not in the same Room via the new test version of the “Voice Mirroring” feature.

Including this error code when contacting support will allow us to assist more smoothly.

■ Other minor fixes to the World Quests system.

■ Minor fixes for the launcher.

items.title: AZKi SOLO LiVE 2025 Support Campaign in Holoearth Announcement
items.author: HoloearthWebsiteAdmin
items.content:
Greetings from the Holoearth Management Team!

From November 12th (Wed), 2025 we are holding a support campaign for AZKi SOLO LiVE 2025 “Departure”!

During the campaign period we will feature a street takeover with the “Departure” key visual and sell commemorative Holoearth merchandise, including a digital version of the concert T-shirt. The background music in the area will also change to “Mirai Campanella” and “from A to Z (Re: arrange ver.).”

Show your support in Holoearth and post your images with #Holoearth!

(Schedule is subject to change.)

Anyone can join in the festivities for free by downloading and installing Holoearth.

(Note: Holoearth is available only for Windows.)

A street takeover featuring the “Departure” key visual, as well as the Re:Start Re:Birth album cover illustration will take place in Alternative City. Users will also be able to take photos with a life-sized standee of AZKi. The background music in the area will also be changed to “Mirai Campanella” until November 20th at 17:59 (JST) and then to “from A to Z (Re: arrange ver.)” until the end of the campaign period.
